intro: Russelia equisetiformis, commonly known as the flame bush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of tubular, red or orange flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are opposite and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is well-suited for warm climates. Russelia equisetiformis is valued in gardens for its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
